intro: Antimima emarcescens, commonly known as the yellow antirrhinum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive two-lipped structure. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Antimima emarcescens thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
